titlestmt.titleproper: American College of Neuropsychopharmacology oral history collection
Finding Aid for the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology Oral History Collection Biomed.1235
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Shira Peltzman, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2020 December 2.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-03 15:37:55 -0700.

did.unittitle: American College of Neuropsychopharmacology oral history collection
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Portions of collection unprocessed. Digital and audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. Please contact Special Collections reference (spec-coll@library.ucla.edu) for more information.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED DIGITAL AND AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Digital and audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], American College of Neuropsychopharmacology Oral History Collection (Collection 1235). Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library History and Special Collections for the Sciences, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of oral history interviews with pioneers in the field of neuropsychopharmacology, chiefly conducted by fellow members of the American College of Neuropsychopharmacology (ACNP). Collection includes digital videocassettes, VHSs, DVDs, audiocassettes, and printed transcripts.
